PM10 examples: dust, pollen, mold 
 
 PM2.5 examples: combustion particles, compounds, metals, smoke and soot, emissions 
 
 People with asthma are at greater risk from breathing in small particles and irritating gases. They can irritate the airways and make asthma worse. 
 
 Ozone (O3): Ozone triggers asthma because it is very irritating to the lungs and airways. 
 
 Nitrogen dioxide (NO2) comes from burning fuels. Breathing in NO2 can cause someone to develop asthma. It can worsen lung disease, especially asthma. 
 
 Sulfur dioxide (SO2) can harm your lungs and lead to health problems. 
 
 Carbon monoxide (CO) has no smell. It can be very dangerous when it builds up inside buildings.
